42 - Marouane Chamakh

After a prolific few years in Ligue 1 with Bordeaux, Arsene Wenger went back to what he knows best - procuring untapped talent in the French market.
Unfortunately for the Arsenal boss, by 2010 his success rate had taken a significant dip. Moroccan striker Chamakh scored about one in four in his debut campaign, but only scored one Premier League goal in his second season.
He was loaned to West Ham, where he did nothing, and then ran around a bit up top for Crystal Palace before failing to convince Tony Pulis to give him a deal at West Brom in 2016.
